alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 5:56AM CDT until September 04 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Franklin TN County in middle Tennessee... Southeastern Moore County in middle Tennessee... * Until 745 AM CDT. * At 556 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across southern Moore County and northern Franklin County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch will be possible in these areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winchester, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Huntland, Tims Ford Lake, Harmony, Belvidere, Arnold AFB, Lexie Crossroads, Maxwell, Marble Hill, Woods Reservoir, Hurdlow, Lois and Alto. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
